body_html: @twolodzko CuDNNLSTM does work in general but you may need to check the shape of the embedding layer or specify input shape inside CuDNNLSTM along with other args. Regardless LSTM and CuDNNLSTM should have minimal difference except for speed. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.
body_text: @twolodzko CuDNNLSTM does work in general but you may need to check the shape of the embedding layer or specify input shape inside CuDNNLSTM along with other args. Regardless LSTM and CuDNNLSTM should have minimal difference except for speed. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.
body: @twolodzko `CuDNNLSTM` does work in general but you may need to check the shape of the embedding layer or specify input shape inside `CuDNNLSTM` along with other args. Regardless `LSTM` and `CuDNNLSTM` should have minimal difference except for speed. Thanks for bringing this to our attention.
